sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 Ã— C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: How many single-digit perfect squares are there in the group table of a non-abelian group of order 36?
message_2:
A group table of a non-abelian group of order 36 has 36 elements. The single-digit perfect squares are 1, 4, and 9. In a group table, the identity element (usually denoted as e) is always present, which corresponds to the perfect square 1. However, the presence of other perfect squares depends on the specific non-abelian group of order 36.

In general, it is not possible to determine the exact number of single-digit perfect squares in the group table of a non-abelian group of order 36 without more information about the group.
